Package org.neo4j.index.internal.gbptree

Class TreeState

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.index.internal.gbptree.TreeState
  • class TreeState
extends Object
    Tree state is defined as top level tree meta data which changes as the tree and its constructs changes, such as:
    • stable/unstable generation numbers
    • root id, the page id containing the root of the tree
    • last id, the page id which is the highest allocated in the store
    • pointers into free-list (page id + offset)
    This class also knows how to write and read tree state to and from a PageCursor, although doesn't care where in the store that is.

      • pageId

        private final long pageId
        Page id this tree state has been read from.

      • stableGeneration

        private final long stableGeneration
        Stable generation of the tree.

      • unstableGeneration

        private final long unstableGeneration
        Unstable generation of the tree.

      • rootId

        private final long rootId
        Page id which is the root of the tree.

      • rootGeneration

        private final long rootGeneration
        Generation of rootId.

      • lastId

        private final long lastId
        Highest allocated page id in the store. This id may not be in use currently and cannot decrease since PageCache doesn't allow shrinking files.

      • freeListWritePageId

        private final long freeListWritePageId
        Page id to write new released tree node ids into.

      • freeListReadPageId

        private final long freeListReadPageId
        Page id to read released tree node ids from, when acquiring ids.

      • freeListWritePos

        private final int freeListWritePos
        Offset in page freeListWritePageId to write new released tree node ids at.

      • freeListReadPos

        private final int freeListReadPos
        Offset in page freeListReadPageId to read released tree node ids from, when acquiring ids.

      • valid

        private boolean valid
        Due to writing with potential concurrent page flushing tree state is written twice, the second state acting as checksum. If both states match this variable should be set to true, otherwise to false.

      • clean

        private final boolean clean
        Is tree clean or dirty. Clean means it was closed without any non-checkpointed changes.

      • write

        static void write​(PageCursor cursor,
                  long stableGeneration,
                  long unstableGeneration,
                  long rootId,
                  long rootGeneration,
                  long lastId,
                  long freeListWritePageId,
                  long freeListReadPageId,
                  int freeListWritePos,
                  int freeListReadPos,
                  boolean clean)
        Writes provided tree state to cursor at its current offset. Two versions of the state are written after each other, the second one acting as checksum for the first, see valid field.
        Parameters:
        cursor - PageCursor to write into, at its current offset.
        stableGeneration - stable generation.
        unstableGeneration - unstable generation.
        rootId - root id.
        rootGeneration - root generation.
        lastId - last id.
        freeListWritePageId - free-list page id to write released ids into.
        freeListReadPageId - free-list page id to read released ids from.
        freeListWritePos - offset into free-list write page id to write released ids into.
        freeListReadPos - offset into free-list read page id to read released ids from.
        clean - is tree clean or dirty

      • read

        static TreeState read​(PageCursor cursor)
        Reads tree state from cursor at its current offset. If checksum matches then valid is set to true, otherwise false.
        Parameters:
        cursor - PageCursor to read tree state from, at its current offset.
        Returns:
        TreeState instance containing read tree state.
